page.title: 01Hopes Reservoir
page.content: The main feature is the Hopes Reservoir created by the dam built across this flat-bottomed valley. It is surrounded by hills, the highest 527 metres lying to the west is an OS triangulation point. The hills are steep-sided and flat on top. Water drains from the hills by narrow fast flowing streams into the reservoir. Heather is the main ground cover on the hills with some gorse and ferns on the lower slopes. Trees, mainly birch appear on the sheltered banks of the reservoir and in the valley to the east of the dam. A mettled track leads to the reservoir and a rough track follows its southern edge to a sheep pen. There is only one house-a shepherds cottage. the main uses of the area are sheep farming and recreational activities such as hill walking, fishing & shooting.
